scenes.label: *start
texts: Wind wasn't a part of Nakano Symphonies, but he provided us with a load of info whenever there was a quest going on.
It felt unnecessary before, but I really appreciated it now.
JA1037E, designated for Flight 302, took off from the Ninoy Aquino International Airport in the Philippines at 6am JST.
We'd been monitoring it since takeoff, but hadn't noticed anything special or quest-like about it.
It was due to arrive at Haneda Airport in five minutes.
Momo said that she'd seen a vision, so we couldn't relax just yet.
She was having a sudden coughing fit.
She was holding the 7cup I'd given her so she could stay hydrated.
I had no idea it could make people cough like that...
You've never had a carbonated drink before?
Don't worry. I know all about them.
Her words brimming with confidence, she took another sip of 7cup.
Momo kept coughing for a short while afterwards.
Yeah, I was pretty sure that was her first 7cup...
It's not clear yet, but something's happened!
If this news report is credible, the plane's flying away from Haneda.
Flight 302 was almost full, with over 200 people onboard.
If all those passengers were in danger, there was way more at stake on this quest than either of the previous ones.
I hoped that wasn't the case, but we barely even had time to hope.
Is all this the same as in your vision?
She said she was unsure, but her gloomy expression said otherwise.
Don't worry. Your vision won't come true. I won't let it.
Woo! Look at our boy showing off again!
I know, I know. You're always a man of your word, right?
Yeah! I'm gonna be the first person to complete a quest!

scenes.label: *polonsave8
texts: I'll need your power, so you better not take it away before I'm done.
First, I gotta get some info.
We were keeping a close eye on what was happening, but the situation was changing every second.
We were looking at the news, social media, and whatever else we could find to get as tight a grip on things as possible.
The first thing we had to check was...
Huh? This looks legit, doesn't it? It is, right?
The URL he sent me had a voice file.
It had been <tips,36,machine translated>, so I could understand what was being said when I played it.
We've switched to airband due to STS failure.

scenes.label: *musen
texts: Airband. Sounds like talk between Flight 302 and the control tower.
We have trouble. The autopilot is going off-course.
Please use the code to cancel it.
I've tried lots of times now!
Tell the other planes to stay away. We—
The autopilot's out of control, huh?
Was it just a system error or...?
They said that the STS isn't working.
It was all airband before, but now most planes use the STS lines.
It uses different channels though, to prevent interference with wi-fi and—
Oh, sorry. I won't confuse you with the details.
It's okay. I'm familiar enough with it, I think.
If he used the STS to take over 302, that would mean he broke through its tight security...
That's gotta be child's play for Cicada.
It's worth looking into, anyway. I'll access Haneda Airport and check on the STS status.
Cross took in hand the folded device that was hanging from his belt, then pressed on its handle.
Next, he docked the circular unit in the middle.
The upper part of the unit rose slightly, exposing the LED lights hidden around it. It began to spin at a high speed.
Slightly above the LEDs, Cross began moving his hands like he was both communicating in morse code and DJing. That was his input method.
Wind got to work too, striking weird poses and submitting commands with exaggerated movements.
I'll connect to the plane's wi-fi so I can look inside.
I doubt I was the first person with this idea, though.
Sure enough, the plane was overwhelmed with access attempts coming from around the world.
It wasn't easy to connect under these conditions, but if I could pull it off, I'd probably learn something useful.
You think you can do it? Didn't you only start using BMI yesterday?
Momo's eyes were burning with determination.
She must be feeling a real sense of duty after seeing that vision.
All right. I'll teach you how, so first, connect to the wi-fi.
I shared an access tool with her and taught her the basics. She picked it up fairly quickly and got started just as fast.
Using STS and wi-fi would allow us to know what was happening inside the plane, so I figured I might as well focus on the outside.
I chose a contact and suddenly heard some music.
Right as it stopped, an <tips,38,avatar> comprised of a 3D-scanned face appeared at the edge of my vision.
Oz, there's something I wanna ask you.
Ask later, then. I gotta go to MLIT.
Hm? The Ministry of Land, Infrastructure, Transport and Tourism? Now?
If it's about Flight 302, wanna share what we know? I'm looking into it for the quest.
For that game, huh? Man, who plays with people's lives like that?
What are you getting mad at me for...? Anyway, you wanna share the info or not?
Never hurts to know more, I guess.
Ah! My bad! Gimme a sec!
I ended the call for now, and looked at Momo's access tool.
Awesome! I'll take over from here.
My own connection was being destabilized by countless others trying to connect. It could cut out at any time, so we couldn't waste a second.
I ran my fingers over my keyboard.
There was no time to target the plane's systems, so instead I went for...

scenes.label: *bmi

timeline.timeline: 追加_腕c切り替えばたばたループ

stoptimeline.stoptimeline: 追加_腕c切り替えばたばたループ

texts: I hacked into one of the passengers' tablets, then turned its camera on so I could see inside the cabin.
I could see way more if I hacked into someone's BMI, but their security was way too tight to hack in such a short amount of time.
I moved from tablet to tablet, looking for a decent angle.
Most of the passengers were still seated, but the rest were anxiously walking around or shouting at each other, terrified.
People were standing in front of the cockpit door. They were shouting at the purser to let them in so they could speak with the captain.
There was one thing I didn't see, though.
I couldn't see a single person using knives or guns to terrorize the passengers.
There goes the connection. We got enough, though.
I uploaded the recording I got to <tips,39,PicDrop>.
Is this from the plane?! Takaoka! My man! You're actually competing with the other hackers!
Momo's the one who connected to the plane's wi-fi, though.
WOOO! Lovey-dovey co-op! Ya love to see it! I gotta upload this!

timelines.label: 追加_腕c切り替えばたばたループ
追加_腕c切り替えばたばたループ

texts: All data found has gotta be shared! It's common courtesy to everyone else on the quest!
Oh, but I can't post Aizaki's name, can I? Hmm... I guess I'll just do this, then.
I was gonna get the third degree from all the hackers I knew...
So this is what's going on.
Cross had figured something out from his Haneda Airport hack.
Both the STS and the plane's systems were hacked into and taken over from the outside.
And the plane's autopilot is being controlled by guidance data sent from somewhere outside the airport.
So there weren't any hijackers 'cause the jacking happened remotely.
This is the first-ever hijacking from the ground!
Wind shared so much info that my whole field of view was buried with text and images.
I closed it all and used my own app to check 4chan. The /hack/ers were realizing this was all part of the quest, and going wild.
Someone used the remaining fuel to calculate how much longer the plane could stay airborne, then distributed a countdown app moments later.

scenes.label: *load
texts: There's never a good reason to mess with people's lives like this, especially not so many at once!
Only the greatest hackers could get anything done in such a small window, but quests were never generous with their timeframes.
We just had to work with what we were given.

scenes.label: *select1
texts: ...Oh yeah! I can just make some time.
Hell, I can stop this whole shitshow from happening in the first place.
